title: Understanding RBAC and Employee Roles
description: Learn about the relationship between Employee roles and RBAC permissions

sections.title: Overview
sections.content:
The system uses two complementary role systems:

1. **Employee Roles** - Organizational job titles (Partner, CA, Advocate, Manager, Staff, RM, Finance, Admin)
2. **RBAC Roles** - System permission levels (SuperAdmin, Admin, Manager, Staff, ReadOnly)

These systems work together automatically to ensure employees have appropriate system access based on their organizational role.

sections.title: Why Two Role Systems?
sections.content:
**Employee Roles** represent your organization's structure and job titles. They help with:
- Case assignments
- Task delegation
- Organizational reporting
- Workload management

**RBAC Roles** control system permissions and access. They manage:
- What features users can access
- What data they can view and modify
- Administrative capabilities
- Security boundaries

sections.title: Automatic Role Mapping
sections.content:
When you assign an Employee Role, RBAC permissions are automatically assigned:

| Employee Role | RBAC Role | Access Level |
|--------------|-----------|-------------|
| Partner | SuperAdmin | Full system access |
| CA | Admin | Administrative access |
| Advocate | Manager | Team management |
| Manager | Manager | Team coordination |
| Staff | Staff | Own work scope |
| RM | Manager | Team visibility |
| Finance | Manager | Team visibility |
| Admin | Admin | System configuration |

This happens automatically when you create or update an employee.

sections.title: Permission Details
sections.content:
**SuperAdmin** (Partner)
- Full system access
- All administrative privileges
- User management
- System configuration

**Admin** (CA, Admin)
- Administrative access
- User management (limited)
- Financial and compliance management
- System settings

**Manager** (Advocate, Manager, RM, Finance)
- Team management
- Case and client oversight
- Task coordination
- Team member visibility

**Staff**
- Access to assigned work
- Own tasks and cases
- Limited visibility
- No administrative access

sections.title: Managing Roles
sections.content:
**To change an employee's access:**
1. Go to Employee Masters
2. Edit the employee
3. Change their Employee Role
4. RBAC permissions update automatically

**To view effective permissions:**
1. Go to RBAC Management
2. Find the user in User Role Assignment
3. Click the eye icon to preview permissions

**Important Notes:**
- Only active employees receive RBAC roles
- Deactivating an employee removes their system access
- Manual RBAC role assignments are preserved
- Changes take effect immediately

sections.title: Best Practices
sections.content:
1. **Use Employee Roles for organizational structure** - Assign roles based on job function
2. **Let the system manage RBAC** - Automatic mapping ensures consistency
3. **Review permissions regularly** - Use the RBAC Management interface
4. **Deactivate instead of delete** - Maintains audit trails
5. **Test with Staff role first** - Verify access before promoting

sections.title: Troubleshooting
sections.content:
**User can't access features:**
- Verify employee is Active
- Check Employee Role is appropriate
- View effective permissions in RBAC Management
- Ensure no conflicting deny permissions

**RBAC roles not updating:**
- Roles sync automatically on create/update
- Check browser console for errors
- Verify employee status is Active
- Contact support if issues persist

**Too much/too little access:**
- Review Employee Role assignment
- Check the role mapping table
- Consider manual RBAC role adjustments
- Document any custom permissions
